direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods add elements to the collection, but addAll adds a collection of elements while add adds a single element.
Both methods modify the collection by adding or removing elements, but in opposite directions.
Both methods modify the collection by adding or retaining elements, but retainAll retains only the specified elements.
Both methods involve adding collections, but addComposited adds a collection to the composite while addAll adds elements from a collection to the composite.
Both methods handle exceptions similarly, such as UnsupportedOperationException, ClassCastException, NullPointerException, and IllegalArgumentException.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require setting up the composite collection before adding elements.
Setting the CollectionMutator is necessary before performing any mutating operations like addAll.
add(E) can be invoked before or after addAll(Collection<? extends E>) to test incremental addition of elements.
removeAll(Collection<?>) can be invoked after addAll(Collection<? extends E>) to test the removal of added elements.
contains(Object) can be used to verify that the elements added by addAll(Collection<? extends E>) are present in the collection.
size() can be used to verify the total number of elements in the collection after addAll(Collection<? extends E>) is called.
toArray() can be used to verify the contents of the collection after addAll(Collection<? extends E>) is called.
